column4: I am not sure, but I think either my HD, or my controller, of my motherboard crashed.
I have been looking everywhere on google, supoprt forums, anything to figure out what went bad. :(
I am not sure, but I think either my HD, or my controller, of my motherboard crashed. Need some help in troubleshooting to find out what went wrong.
I am not sure, but I think either my HD, or my controller, of my motherboard crashed. Need some help in troubleshooting to find out what went wrong.
What symptoms are you seeing?

I am hearing a low buzz and then a shorter high buzz from the harddrive, last night I created the workaround for hdd unload/load cycles as directed by launchpad seeing that I was getting 80+ loads/unloads on idle per minute on my SMART functions.
does SMART report anything odd?
I can't even access S.M.A.R.T because of a bios error code 0200 fixed disk error which I cannot resolve with either google, or forums as to the exact nature of the failiure.
Unplugging the hdd resolves the 0200?
Yes it does, and I can boot a live cd after that.
Thinkpads in general work great.
Alright then it's almost certainly the hdd.  Do you have an alternate that you can try to plug in?
not atm.
this is the second harddrive that has crashed in this laptop :/
Ouch!  one thing you can do is when you have ubuntu up and running next, install the 'smartmontools' package.  You can get SMART info from the disk. (sorry if you already knew that)
no problem and I did :) thats how I got my load/unload cycle count increase/hr
the problem now though is that I can't even boot a livecd with the harddrive in, because it doesn't boot all the way.

I've had weirdness with bad hard drives causing like 2 minute delays for the POST, or 10 minute boot times from a CD.  A new hdd solved the problem.  I'm not sure if it was IRQ goofiness or just the system attempting ide resets so often that it borked other things... but I'd put money on the drive rather than the controller or mobo  as of right now.
sounds good, ikonia has great advice.  A few hours of homework before the purchase can save a ton of headaches and work. =)
blah, went to the compatibility confirmed page on ubuntu website, haven't yet to see a thinkpad :)
Hmmm, I've ran it great on my T23, A31 and R61i.  =P  That's only my experience though.
